item.description:
In Die Mumien des Pharao, which the publisher calls the spiritual successor of Der zerstreute Pharao, a.k.a. Ramses II, players are attempting to get the mummies of the pharaohs back to their tombs with their pets. However, the pets are not just hiding, but wandering around beneath the pyramids! The first player to get all the mummies and their respective pets back into the pyramid tombs wins!

Die Mumien des Pharao includes rules for solo play.

item.description: Nautico is a family game for 2 to 4 players. By rolling an die pawns move along a row of cards depicting different sea inhabitants valued 1 to 40 and 9 Nautico cards. When a player moves the last pawn from a card, he must take it and put it in the beginning or and of row with increasing numbers or start a new row. At the end points of the cards of the highest valued row are counted. Nautico cards can be used to combine rows, but yield negative points if not used.

Towers of the Sun is an abstract strategy game in which two to four players take on the role of mystical clans each coming from their own unique and beautiful regions. They’ve lived in peace and harmony until a dangerous and mysterious mist begins to gradually cover their world, blocking out the sunlight. The clans must now compete to collect the remaining sunlight, and build majestic towers to escape the mist and reach towards the sun.

During the game players will build and navigate a changing, three-dimensional landscape. The playing field is limited and players will compete for the best positions, occasionally battling it out with their hand cards in a simple, yet mind-boggling duel of simultaneous reveal. As they navigate the board, players will collect sun crystals that other players have dropped. At the end of each round the sun shines upon a different tower presenting the players with additional sun crystals. Before a new round begins, players will score points based on which tower they stand upon and the crystals they’ve collected so far.

The main mechanisms used in the game are its modular board (mutated by the players via tile placement), area control, hand management and deductive logic (for the card battles). Beyond the strategy of building and managing their tower tiles, players must also think ahead and not be too greedy because after the scoring phase of each round the leading player will have to exercise their generosity and care by providing charity to the lowest scoring player. This adds both rubber-banding and interactivity that makes every game tense until the last sun crystal has been claimed.

The game comes to end when all of the sunlight is gone. This happens naturally, with sun crystals being collected each round, but players can also force this to happen early by standing atop a tower of 8 tiles or more and essentially “reaching the sun”.

—description from the publisher

item.description: Fruit patisserie is a bingo battling card game using eleven cards. Players will play cards to complete a line of three cards (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). The player who plays the biggest card can turn over his bingo card. If there are multiple cards with the largest number, the player who played the card with the lowest number can turn over his bingo card. When to use your shopping card to return all of your cards to your hand is the key to the game. Which player can bingo first and make sweets? It is a game that you can play many times with easy-to-understand, simple rules.

In the language party game Lingo Twist, you will struggle to make yourself understood, and whether you have your fingers in your mouth or your tongue stretched out far, you want to speak as clearly as possible. Good luck!

item.description:
In 'Magos y Tabernas' (which stands for 'Mages & Taverns' in spanish) a group of mages meet in a tavern where there's only one beer left. They then decide to fight for it using an ancient and magical card game. Mages & Taverns is a fast paced, soft strategy card game with bits of bluffing, negotiation and backstabbing.

The goal of the game is to get the beer. In order to do it, mages will have to condense their energy (3 orbs) in precious gems. The first in getting 3 gems wins the beer.

Players have 1 action point per turn, it can be used to get 1 orb, draw a card or use 1 of the 3 types of cards: Instant, Action or Object. Cards allow players to destroy other players gems, protect their own, summon orbs magically, negate other players action or even copy one, etc.

Three mages and one beer, who is going to get it?

name.value: The Hollow Woods: Storytelling Card Game

item.description:
Fire your imagination with these fun storytelling cards. Reviving the Victorian craze for ‘myrioramas’, the 20 picture cards can be placed in any order to create seamless scenes. Almost infinite combinations of cards provide endless storyscaping possibilities. Traverse an enchanted landscape as you build a perpetual panorama inhabited by fire-breathing dragons, magical unicorns and sinister shadow figures. With many games to play and millions of stories to tell, each turn of the card is a new adventure. Where will the story take you? There are over two quintillion storyscaping possibilities, and you can build a seamless panorama stretching up to 170cm!

Description from the publisher's website

item.description:
The word building family game that’s sure to bring endless fun & laughter to game time. Build words to score points. The more words, the more points you get or so you think. It’s not just about out spelling or out wording your opponents but
developing a game plan. Don’t Blow It will frustrate you and it will challenge you, because play an OOPS UP! card at the
wrong time and just when you think you have it in the bag. OOPS you’ve blown it. Words & letters can be flipped, swiped,
swopped and even added to your hand right under your nose,which just adds to the fun. It’s the game for everyone including
Grandad because all that counts is your ability to make words and have awesome fun doing so. Hey, it will even help improve
your maths skills.

Discover old manuscripts, statues and treasures by excavating the collapsed chambers of a temple in Artifact Stack. Be warned as the treasures within contain not only wealth, but also undead creatures and curses! Each single game is different with multiple artifact decks to build your temple!

link.value: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

item.description:
User summary
ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹ (STATUS) is a Japanese word deduction game which uses a radar chart. Radar charts are a familiar way in Japan to show information on things like products or people.

In this game, some of the players are known as 'Parents' and write down hidden answers they others are seeking to discover. The other players are 'Respondents' try to get information from the Parents based on cards they have in their hand. The Respondents ask questions, and the Parents plot their responses on the radar chart on the board.

Before the game begins, Clue Cards are placed around the five axes of the radar chart, with each Clue Card have different words on them. Pins are applied to select one clue word on each axis. The clue words are adjectives or nouns such as thickness, money, size, drink, technique, weight, and so on.

In this way, the Respondents try to derive the hidden word form the strengths of clues on the chart. The publisher's site includes images of a completed chart where the hidden word is related to food.

This game was a sell out at the Tokyo Game Market in 2017 and has now been re-issued and can be bought through the publisher's online shop. The contents include a game board, 53 hint cards, 10 pins, re-usable marker pens, a cleaner cloth and other components.

link.value: KUDARANAIMONO factory (くだらないもの工房)

item.description:
The crazy party game for crazy people, Acts Of Insanity is charades on over-drive where the subjects are unimaginably wild and the opposing team holds your destiny in their hands! Drawing 5 Character, Action, Location or Object cards at random then selecting just one, you have just 2 minutes to act it out for your team.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
A WWI Board Game - #6 in the Somme Series

A two player board game of generalship at army level during World War I and is a race against time which begins on the second day of the British offensive.

The British must break through and capture Bapaume before the onset of winter. Can the German defences hold and stymie the British assault with the perfect counter attack? Can you do better than Haig and von Falkenhayn & Ludendorff?

VIII Corps v1.0 
£13.25 each.
Game board (A3, folded).
Tracker board (A5).
Set of counters (A5, not pre-cut).
Rules (A4, two pages plus covers).
All items except rules in full colour.
Printed on 350 gsm quality white card.
Comes in a grip seal bag.
Shipped in a card backed envelope.

The game is a simple way to introduce children to the world of route planning, helping them develop their logic and spatial intelligence skills, with 46 challenges.
For each challenge, you need to work out the right route for getting your playing piece to its destination.
Each scene has different coloured paths, interrupted by circular spaces.
Look at the objectives on the game card, then take the number of bars indicated on the card to complete your route.
Look at the different possible routes in the scene, then place the bars in the correct order on the white spaces on the game card.
Move your piece in the same way you have placed the bars on the game card to see if you have plotted your route correctly.

When you are more familiar with the game, you can challenge your friends to see who can complete the game card first. 
Playing side-by-side, each player takes 3 coloured bars. Take the CITY or PLANET scene of your choice, together with the appropriate playing piece and game cards. Place the scene and the playing piece in the centre of the table and put the game cards in a pile. Pick a game card from the pack, then place it in front of you. The players must try to solve the game card at the same time. To plot your course, place the bars closest to you directly onto the board (instead of on the card). When a player thinks they have found the right solution they must say “STOP”. If you have placed the bars on the board correctly you keep the card. If not, the other player gets to keep the card. Continue the game by choosing another game card. The winner is the first person to get 3 cards.

Five Ravens is a quick game that combines deckbuilding and tableau building. Every player begins with the same nine cards, each of whom belong to a band of thieves. On your turn, you play one raven for its action, or denote it as your thief.

At the end of the round, players choose one relic using their chosen thieves to indicate selection order. Then, the Raven is permanently removed from your deck. This grants a bonus, or penalty, that affects your choices.

Players will see diverging strategies and lots of variability in such a small game with only five rounds.

—description from the designer

The MMA Combat Card Game is a two player game that brings the in-cage action of a mixed martial arts fight to your table.

Choose from a number of theme decks, including The Brawler, Tap Out Artist, Muay Thai Specialist, and more. When you've got a few fights under your belt, customize your own deck. The only thing standing between you and greatness is 3 Five-minute rounds... if you can last that long!

A game consists of Three Rounds. During each round both players get 5 turns each. Players start at 30 Toughness. When your toughness reaches Zero, you are "knocked out!" At the end of 3 rounds, if no player is knocked out, go to the judges scorecards to determine a winner - players count up the total victory points on successfully played cards during the game. Highest victory point total wins!

—description from the publisher

What's happening here? It looks like your neighbors have gathered together to create a pyramid out of straw, wood, and stone. Cool! But wait a minute, why do some people seem to be causing small collapses on purpose? And why does little Susie have a blowtorch?

In Flaming Pyramids, players are building one pyramid together using square tiles, but each player is trying to be the first to get rid of their own tiles.

There are 40 regular tiles with a unique combination of color, number, and material. Except toward the end of the game, players have a hand of five tiles from which to choose, but they are constrained by the building regulations and the luck of the draw. There are also four tiles that can cause fires and one extra-heavy "wild" tile: these can be harder to place without causing extensive damage the later they emerge. If your placed tile causes mayhem (a collapse, fire, or explosion), the damaged tiles go back in your supply.

Flaming Pyramids can be played as a friendly, casual game, an easy starter or filler, or as no-holds-barred multi-round competition.

Combines memorization, bluffing, economics and combat. Crimson Sands is set in an ancient fantasy world where giant lizards and large flightless birds are used to transport guards and goods between four cities separated by a hostile desert. The birds are fast, but cannot carry much. The lizards are slow, but can carry a great deal.

The players must balance trade goods, guards, and water if their caravans are to reach the other side alive. The game includes miniatures of the beasts that carry the tiles representing these guards, goods and the tiles representing raider opponents.

Besides limited water, the principle danger in the desert is the raiders and their dread leader, the self-styled Raider Queen. At the conclusion of their turn a player must draw an encounter card, view it secretly, and then decide where to place it on the game board. Players can choose ever longer routes to avoid encounter cards or risk the hazard to take a direct route to their goal.

If the raiders are encountered, battle will ensue. The other players control the raiders in these fast-paced contests. The defending player must decide how to best ward off attacks and get as many elements of the caravan to safety as possible. The raiders have to decide whether to intercept and make off with individual beasts or try to eliminate all the guards and capture the entire caravan.

—description from the publisher

"The increasing destabilization of the political and economic situation in the Soviet Union is undercutting our positions in the world. The pride and honor of the Soviet people must be restored in full."
Public Declaration of State Committee for the State of Emergency in the U.S.S.R., June 11, 1985


1985: Under an Iron Sky is the spiritual successor of The Next War by SPI: an operational, highly detailed simulation of a NATO - Warsaw Pact conflict in Central Europe.

Being a so-called "Monster", 1985 is not exactly a beer and pretzel game. Rules include every aspect of modern warfare, leaving little or nothing on an abstract level: air war, helicopters, electronic warfare, special forces, revolts, nuclear and chemical warfare.....you name it. In order to survive, both sides must keep a constant eye on the front line, the rear areas and on the sky above.

				
					Game Parts


 3 95x65cm and 2 31x24cm maps, depicting Central Europe from Denmark to Northern Italy
 2000+ counters, representing Warsaw Pact and NATO combat and support units
 65 pages Rules booklet
 60 pages Scenario / Designer’s Notes booklet
 10 Charts and Tables sheets in full colour


				
					Game Highlights


 Order of Battle and TO&E are not “generic”, but set exactly in July, 1985
 14km per hex, 48 hours per game turn
 Division / Brigade sized ground combat units 
 Squadron sized Air and Helicopter units
 Extensive air war rules covering Escort, Intercept, SEAD, Wild Weasel, Ground Strike and more
 EF-111 and Yak28 PP Offensive ECM Squadrons
 E-3 Sentry and A-50 Mainstay AWACS Squadrons
 Special Forces, Airmobile, Paratroops, Electronic Warfare, Artillery, SSM, SAM and Air Defense Artillery units
 Rules for Chemical Warfare, Nuclear Warfare and uncontrolled escalation to Strategic Nuclear Exchange
 Specific operational tactics like Airmobile Antitank Battalions, Active Defense and Single-Echelon Assaults
 Variable NATO reinforcements, depending on players’ decisions and events in the battle of North Atlantic
 Variable Warsaw Pact reinforcements, depending on Pact’s decision for Mobilization and Norway Invasion
 Unrest and Revolts in Warsaw Pact countries
 Two different Campaign Games:
 “Forward, Comrades!”, the classical Warsaw Pact offensive in Central Europe
 “It Started in the Shipyards”, NATO intervention in support of widespread revolts in Warsaw Pact satellite countries
 
 Four smaller scenarios:
 “Checkpoint Charlie”, the battle for West Berlin
 “A Damned Nice Thing”, Warsaw Pact main attack against NORTHAG
 “Mind the Gap”, Warsaw Pact secondary attack against CENTAG
 "Para Bellum", Warsaw Pact offensive against Italy following a stalemate on Central front

item.description:
In the jungle, the animals are on the loose! The Monkey King invites his animal friends from around the world. Will the new tree house carry this number of guests after all? The more animals ascend to the tree house, the more wobbly it becomes. Strategy is therefore asked - How do you get most of the animals on the tree house without collapsing it or the animals falling down?
—description from the publisher
Concentration card game where the players should match the number of seeds of watermelon on the table and their hands.

A trivia game developed in cooperation with the Finnish Donald Duck magazine. The questions have a heavy emphasis on stories by Carl Barks and Don Rosa.

A stand-alone travel version of Aku Ankka that can also be used as an expansion. Cards contain trivia questions in four categories.

Circle of Jerks is a fast-paced, sensational party game that requires players to compete while yelling the most-inappropriate sexual terms you can imagine!

Incredibly easy to learn! Each round lasts only 15-60 seconds.

Race your friends to identify the matching symbol between cards. You can only place a card if you shout out its ridiculous name out loud!

You can take Circle of Jerks anywhere! Play it at a bar, a pregame or a basic sorority social. Pull it out at a quiet coffee shop or during a boring lecture. Are you dreading going to that funeral for a great-uncle you've never met?

Bring life to the party with Circle of Jerks!

—description from the publisher

Featuring all original artwork inspired by Art Nouveau, Lygari! is a fun bluffing game for 3-6 players, where each player is one of the Einherjar in Valhalla boasting about their conquests!

In Lygari!, there are 13 different monsters from Norse myth, and players take turns boasting about what creatures they have defeated in their previous life before coming to Valhalla. Cards are played face down, while players claim them to be one of the monsters in the game. It's up to other players to determine if each play is a bluff. Play continues until either one player has played all their cards, or the draw pile is exhausted.

During their turn, players have a choice of making a boast, calling the previous player a Lygari, or just drinking mead. When making a boast, a player plays any number of cards from their hand, face down, and claims them to be one of the 13 monsters in the game. If the next player calls their bluff, the cards are revealed. If they matched the previous player's claim, the calling player must take all cards played so far into their hand, otherwise, the lying player takes all cards played into their hand. A player may instead opt to "pass" by drinking mead and drawing a card from the stock. When the mead runs out (all cards are drawn), whoever has the fewest cards left in their hand is the winner!

Lygari! is the second in a series of games from Green Fairy Studios LLC in a shared setting of Mystique, where beings from ancient myth return to our modern day world. Lygari! highlights just some of the fantasical beings from Yggdrasil, the Nine Worlds of Norse myth!

—description from the publisher

name.value: ねこチーズをうばえ (Neko Cheese Wo Ubae)
どーぶつ・すとらぐる (Dobutsu Struggle)
満足したいねずみたち (Manzoku shitai nezumitachi)
すぺーす・ぺっとしょっぷ (Space Petshop)
アマゾンの度胸だめし (Amazon no dokyou dameshi)

item.description:
In Fortune & Folly, each player manages their own trading house in a fantasy world set roughly in the Elizabethan era. Grow your trading company by commissioning new ships and direct your fleets to win monopolies on key trade routes and harbors in a race to be recognized as the Queen’s Royal Trading Company! 
 
SUMMARY: 
Fortune & Folly is a worker management game with a rich nautical theme and very approachable rules. Event cards are drawn each turn and serve the dual purpose of normalizing game length and driving strategies that become more complex as players get more comfortable with the ecosystem at work in the game’s mechanics. But getting into the adventure is easy. You start with three ships and move them between harbors and routes to score points based on the price of the goods moved over that route. Winning harbors allows you to place more ships and grow your fleet. When the last event card is resolved, the player with the highest score wins!

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW:
Players start with a fleet of three ships on the board and can grow their fleet to ten by commanding monopolies on the harbor islands. Use trade ships to claim trade routes and gain Fortune points and direct pirates to harry your enemy company's efforts. Players will plan and then take each step of their turn with the help of their turn order card which includes a step to choose a world event card. Three of these events are shown next to the deck, so you'll have three shown options during this phase, or you can choose the top card of the deck at random. Once there are too few event cards to replenish the four options, the current player takes their turn and game is scored. Whoever has the most Fortune wins!

Each turn you will: 
1) Draw and resolve a card
2) Move a ship to a route or harbor island sharing a way point 
3/4) Optionally, you may get to make additional moves, or move pirate ships around
5) Score points for routes you monopolize 
6) Place new ships for each harbor island you monopolize

ATTRIBUTES:
There are four dice, but they are used as counters for commodity prices. 
There are always the same number of turns because of the number of World Event cards and there's a mechanic called the Royal Court card that is used to speed up games that start to run a little longer due to players' deliberating more over their turns.  
The World Event cards present the only real randomness in the game, but you'll always have four options (including the option to pick a card at random). 
A strategy guide is included in the rule book, so you can really hit the ground running.

Designer Notes:
This game is meant to be super easy to get learn, even for those just getting into the hobby, but to introduce layers as you become familiar with the mechanics. 
You'll be carefully planning your move and thinking like a shrewd trade company manager in no time! 
This game was developed over the course of almost two decades and we're so proud of how it turned out. Many thanks to Erwin Arozza for his contribution of stunning artwork that we think really brings the rich nautical, sometimes piratey, theme to life. We hope you'll have as much fun playing fortune & Folly as we do!

—description from the publisher

Each summer Queen Idriana travels to the the greatest festival in all the land. The Festival is the best opportunity to show your abilities to organize street performers into a festive force that can ignite the senses and imaginations of any audience throughout the realm. Can you capture the attention of the Queen and become the Busker Baron or Baroness?

As a Busker Lord or Lady you must choose from a collection of royal street performers and outperform the other Busker Lords and Ladies who are simultaneously selecting their own performers. The Queen wants to see who can best manage their troop. After drafting your performers, your goal is to keep the most performers in your hand for the final encore. Your best chance is to convince the Festival's watching crowd and the other royal street performers that your troop is the best. If you have the most performers in your hand at the end of the game, you win Queen Indriana’s royal contract and become the Busker Baron or the Busker Baroness for the next summer's Festival!

name.value: The Tea Dragon Society Card Game

item.description:
Discover the ancient art form of Tea Dragon care-taking within The Tea Dragon Society Card Game, based on the graphic novel The Tea Dragon Society. Create a bond between yourself and your Tea Dragon that grows as you progress through the seasons, creating memories to share forever.

Each player's deck represents their own Tea Dragon. From turn to turn, players choose to draw a card — triggering effects and strengthening their position — or buy a card, improving their deck or scoring points. The game takes place over four seasons, starting in spring and ending in winter. At the end of winter, the player who has the most points wins.

item.description:
Sea of Plunder will be live on kickstarter from July 3rd 2018 10:30am through August 7th!

Kickstarter Link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1225348531/sea-of-plunder-a-fun-light-strategy-treasure-hunti#

Sea of Plunder is a light weight strategy game about treasure hunting in which you are a merchant ship sailing across the endless sea, racing to get to mysterious treasure islands while at the same time gathering goods from port cities,dodging pirates, getting pushed around by hurricanes, and stealing cargo from the other merchants/treasure hunters!

Scoring and Goal: Four things are taken into account for scoring at the end of the game.
Treasures- The players can gather treasures from the mysterious treasure islands throughout the game. 
Goods-A second way is by collecting the unique goods that are produced at each of the port cities located on the 4 home islands. The goods are a set collection objective where you get more points for having multiple different types of goods. (this means that you have to travel to the multiple islands or trade with another merchant for them) 
Magical Compasses-A player is also awarded points at the end of the game for each "magical compass" that they possess. All the players are given these through out the game but they can also gain these in trades from other players. 
Debt-Each player is deducted points based on the amount of debt that they have gained throughout the game. A player will obtain debt any time that they come into contact with pirates and are unable to bribe them with a good. In this instance the pirates attach the ship and the player gains debt which represents the price that they had to pay for repairs 
The player with the total highest score wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the most magical compasses left wins.

Game Play: Players take turns in clockwise fashion. They will draw two cards and add them to their hand. They then choose to play a card (a treasure map, port city, or action card) these will commonly affect the active player (Exceptions would include some action cards). The player then chooses to discard a card. The card discarded allows the player to choose a pirate on the map and move it accordingly

Action Cards: Allow the player to preform more complex combos or implement some take that upon the other players.

Event Cards: These are cards that are dispersed throughout the draw deck. When they appear they do not count as one of your draws or plays but they are played immediately and affect all players.

Treasure Islands: The game starts with one treasure island in the middle of the board. When a player sails across a treasure island they have now discovered it and found the treasure. That treasure island will disappear off the map and a new treasure island location will be randomly generated. Event cards such as "Tales of More Treasure" cause new treasure islands to be generated onto the board so that by the end of the game there are multiple options of islands that you can choose to sail towards.

The Pirates: There are four pirate ships that can be moved across the board according to each players discard. You can use the pirates to discover the treasure islands (the pirate would get the treasure) if an opponent is getting to close to it for comfort. You can also sail the pirate into another player forcing them to loose a good or accumulate debt. You may also place a pirate on the port cities to help blockade your opponent merchants from gathering the goods from that city.

Game End: The game end can be triggered in two ways. When a player has collected 3 treasures or when the pirates have collected 6 treasures. When the game end is triggered, the players finish the round and then calculate final scoring.

Each box will include both an english translation and a german translation.

Featuring collectible tokens including Garnet's Gauntlet and Greg's Van along with custom gems and gem clusters. It's monopoly with a Steven Universe twist.
Join the crystal gems as you fuse your way to victory by buying, selling, and trading locations from beach city including Big Donut, Keystone motel and the Temple.
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Object of this space game is to be the first player to reach the moon after leaving Earth

It is a simple roll and move game, where players advance their pawns and obey instructions encountered along the way upon landing on the Roman numerals. The track winds in and out until you reach the moon. The first to do so, wins.

This Swedish space game dates back to around the early 1960s.

All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work. ~ 2 Timothy 3:16-17

Bible Books: Match is a fun game and an educational tool to help young and old alike learn and remember the books of the Bible.

The game contains 110 cards which when combined form 32 different game decks of 36 cards each.

Players (or teams) take turns matching pairs of books that fall sequentially in the standard Christian Bible.

Can be played solo as well to test your own memory!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Renegade Acolytes from the church had once attempted to carry out a dark incantation ritual with the help of an old rune tome. To do this, they created a demonic portal over a pentagram with magical gestures. As the rite progressed, some acolytes soon became clear with horror that they were not capable enough to keep these demonic circle upright. What happened to them was not handed down. But now you are in possession of this old rune tome. So what will you do?

In SIGNS, 3 to 9 players try to sustain a sequence of numbers with their hands in each round. They are obliged to follow the rules imposed on them by runes. Each round comes with a further card, so the rules become more and more extensive. Anyone who shows a wrong sign and is caught by the other players must leave the circle. Only the bravest and cleverest summoner will succeed in maintaining the ritual to the end.

SIGNS is the first publication of Rocky Bogdanski, finalist of the 2016 Young Author scholarship and his co-author Kai Wetzel.

—description from the publisher

Ninja Squirrels is the game of color matching, nut snatching fun! Ninja Squirrels are fast food fighters. They race to gather acorns to fill their dens before the winter. To help them grab the most acorns, players take turns flipping cards. When there is a color match, be the first to snatch the correct nut. Collect the most acorns to win!

—description from the publisher

Wild Dash is the card game where animals race to the finish line! Players compete to get the best score by racing with fun animal cards. Reveal your animal card, then add booster cards to propel your animals to the checkered flag at the finish line.

—description from the publisher

Bouncing Bots is the board game where players compete to get the best score by bouncing their bots on the highest valued numbers on the target boards. Score the most points to win!

—description from the publisher

It is a time of War!

Great battles rage and are being fought across all the lands!

Small groups of rogue soldiers, called Grunts, have broken away from the fighting having heard tales of gold, lying untouched and forgotten, around the war ravaged kingdoms.

Lead your team into 4 fantastic locations - where only the most skilled and daring of players will achieve victory against their opponents in the quest for Fortune, Glory and Gold!

Grunts N' Gold is a 2 - 4 player action strategy game where players roll dice and collect and use cards to move and fight there way through the battlefields to get to the Gold. Every team is made up of 4 Grunts and 1 General and the objective is to get your General and 1 of your Grunts into the Gold position and hold off your opponents for 1 turn while you seize it. Weapons can be found and used by collecting loot cards from the battlefield but this comes with the risk of springing booby traps so these must be collected with caution. Greed is bad but Gold is good!

—description from the designer

Utsumi, the tourist town known for its scenic beauty, has a hidden face. Transmitted since ancient times, the tradition of the cursing ceremony called „Ushi-no-Koku-Mairi” (Ox-Hour Shrine-Visit) still persists, and the sound of hammer reverberates throughout the town at night. The curse accumulated in the land is summoning further calamities, and many tourist attractions are turning into haunted spots whirling with malice. People of unusual shapes cast their eyes upon the power of this curse, planning to get it for themselves. A suspicious chase for territory is about to begin!

Moving around the map of the town, wander from one spiritual spot to another, pursuing your rivals. Collect the negative energies scattered over the different places, and use your powers. When it comes to the crunch, play your trump cards. You can use them either to escape or to stop the ones pursuing you. If you catch up with a rival, you will have a chance for a surprise attack. If you succeed, you can snatch away their powers. If you can steal the powers from everyone before daybreak, the game ends, with you as the winner.

Rochi is a gambling game for 2-8 players, played with a Tarot-style deck with six suits of different sizes. It's a new deck design and a whole new way to think about how gambling games should work. There is no betting, very little bluffing, and six different pots!

link.value: King of the Castle Games Company

item.description:
Soldiers of the Sun is a solo, tactical treatment of infantry conflict in the Pacific theater during WWII. The innovative system functions without a map and incorporates a unique activation system that pits units of the team/squad scale against each other. Initiative can change rapidly throughout game turns via chit draw and each turn has the potential to end abruptly with the inclusion of sudden death chits. Unit activation is paid for via point system. Includes 6 scenarios but the real fun starts when you utilize the built in system to construct your own scenarios.

—description from the publisher

A card game for 2-4+ players with a modern combat theme

Players share a common deck comprising cards of 4 different types of military unit (Infantry, Vehicle, Artillery, Air). As well as their Unit type these cards also have an attack characteristic, and an event characteristic. These cards can be used in three different ways - as a unit, to attack, or as an event.

In addition there are Intel cards which do not function as a unit but will list an attack and an event, or two events.

Cards being used as Units are kept face-up on the table in front of the controlling player. Cards put into play as units are said to be Deployed.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 5 phases:


 Logistics Phase 
 Draw 4 cards from the deck.
 
 Deploy Phase
 You may put 1 unit card into play from your hand. 
 
 Attack Phase
 You may make 1 attack this phase by playing a card for its attack function. The attack function of a card will specify attacker type and target type. (e.g. Infantry attacks Vehicle). When a card is being used to attack, you must have the appropriate type of Unit in play (deployed) that can make the attack. The attack targets either the opponent’s base or a specific type of Unit that the opponent has in play. As a result of the attack, the attack card is discarded and the target unit is discarded, or if the base was attacked, the target player will gain 1 damage for each unit that attacked. The attacking unit(s) remain in play. Some event cards will allow the defender to negate the Attack.
 
 Event Phase
 You may play 1 event card this phase. Discard the event card when played. 
 
 Friction Phase
 Max hand size is 5 cards. Give excess cards to one or more opponents. 
 


Players are eliminated when they have accumulated 20 or more points of damage. The goal of the game is to be the last player standing.

name.value: Cerebria: The Inside World – Origin Box

item.description:
KS exclusive version of the game Cerebria: The Inside World
The complete Cerebria experience, with all unlocked Stretch Goals and highly detailed Spirit miniatures.

INCLUDES:

 Cerebria base game
 All unlocked stretch goals
 2 custom-designed Emotion booklets
 Ten 55-60 mm (~2.4") NON-PAINTED Spirit miniatures
 Solo and Co-op Mode
 Plastic tray insert
 Spot UV on main board
 Upgraded components
 Forces of Balance - module (third Identity: 5-6 player mode, alternative 3 player mode)
 2 extra Spirits of Balance (2 miniatures and 2 double-sided player boards




Cerebria is a team-based area control game for 1-6 players, set in a person's mind re-imagined as a vibrant fantasy world.

Players assume the role of Spirits, followers of the Inside World's two opposing forces, Bliss and Gloom, with the goal of shaping Cerebria's Identity to their image. For that purpose, they have been granted power over the Emotions, Cerebria's denizens: they can invoke, move, empower and evolve Emotions to influence and control Cerebria's Realms and Frontiers.

Cerebria's state is in constant flux until a Spirit triggers a Revelation - these are key moments in the game when the current game state is evaluated and is preserved as a permanent Bliss or Gloom fragment on the Identity.

Cerebria is a deep and highly customizable game full of player interaction, where timing and cooperation with your teammate are essential to victory.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Cerebria: The Inside World – Forces of Balance

item.description: Wayward is a fully cooperative board game based on the Image Comics series of the same name in which teenagers imbued with supernatural power defend the world from Yokai, Japanese mythological creatures and spirits. In the game, players assume the roles of the comic's heroes and work together to defeat villains controlled by the game itself.

item.description:
Positioned as an all-out food brawl between the most beloved Nickelodeon characters from the 1990s, Nickelodeon Splat Attack! has players controlling teams that are divided along and flinging food at each other in an effort to hold key positions in the properly-themed food court to become "king of the court"!

Nickelodeon’s Splat Attack! is a 2-4 player game which puts players in control of teams from different brands as they fling food, fight for control of areas, use special abilities to come out the cleanest and avoid getting knocked out! The base game includes 16 highly detailed miniatures of your favorite characters and a whole plate filled with game components and card board elements. Designed by Jonathan Ying (Doom and Imperial Assault) this game is made for miniature games fans and new gamers. SpongeBob and Patrick taking on Tommy and Angelica for control of the food court is what this game is all about!

—description from the publisher

link.value: Nickelodeon Splat Attack! Stretch Goals (5-8 player edition)

item.description:
Mazing is an all new 2-4 player strategy board game where your goal is to get from one corner of the board to the other. Your opponents will try to stop your progress by building and destroying the very walls that surround you and guide your path. If you can navigate this ever-changing landscape and be the first to your home base, you win!

This game is highly strategic and offers new and exciting strategies each time you gather with your family and friends.

We loved making and testing Mazing for you and we sincerely hope you have a great time playing it too. Let the games begin!

What Makes Mazing Unique?

Variability: The game play is never the same twice and alliances are always changing based on your competitors movements

Easy To Learn and Play: Well suited for a wide range of ages
 Strong Game Mechanics: Equal parts strategy and chance

Strategy: Right when you think the game is over, a well-executed plan could change everything

Maze Cards

When played, these maze cards allow the player to place barrier tokens anywhere on the board matching the shape on the card. These tokens act as barrier walls that create the maze that each player needs to navigate to win.

Action Cards

Buster: Remove 1 barrier wall token from anywhere on the board.

Double Buster: Remove 2 touching barrier wall tokens from the board.

Leap: Jump over one 1 barrier wall token. 

 Count barrier wall tokens as one space.
 Players are not allowed to land on a barrier wall token but are always required to move their pawn the full number of spaces that are rolled.




Double Leap: Jump 2 touching barrier tokens.

Lose A Turn: Choose any player to lose their next turn.

—description from the publisher

The bag with the cash is disappeared. The Boss is angry and wants his money back. When he will discover who is trying to fool him, he will deliver to him/her a wonderful present: a nice pair of cement shoes that will turn out to be very comfortable during underwater strolls.

One player is the boss, while the others are the remaining members of the “famiglia”. They try to Pass the Blame to each other, in order to avoid the Boss’s fury. In doing so, they also try to protect their Darling, hoping to succeed in escaping with the money.

During their turn the players try to play Excuses Cards that match with Boss’s Mood. In order to do so, they have to use their imagination, by inventing stories that both match with the played Excuses Cards and sound credible. Be Careful! Every time that a player succeeds in Pass the Blame, the Suitcases Cards pass from one player to another.

As soon as a player can’t invent credible stories anymore, the Boss looses his patience and dispenses his fair Judgement against both the unlucky player and his/her protector. At this point the game ends and the player who owns the Bag with the Cash can slip away with the money. However, if the Bag with the Cash was in the hands of the accused player of in those of his/her protector, the Boss gets the money back and wins the game.


la Borsa con il malloppo è sparita. Il Boss la rivuole indietro e quando scoprirà chi ha tentato di “farlo fesso” gli fare un bel regalo: due scarpe di cemento da utilizzare per una gita in fondo alla baia.

Un giocatore impersona il Boss, mentre gli altri giocatori sono gli altri membri della “famiglia”. Questi si Scaricano la Colpa l'un l'altro, per evitare la furia del Boss. Nel farlo, cercano anche di proteggere il proprio Prediletto, nella speranza di riuscire a scappare con il malloppo.

Durante il proprio turno i giocatori cercano di utilizzare le Carte Scusa dalla propria mano per riuscire a giocarne una che combaci con l’Umore del Boss. Per farlo si è costretti a lavorare di fantasia, inventado storie che, non solo devono rispettare gli spunti delle Carte Scusa giocate, ma devono anche risultare plausibili. Ma attenzione! Ogni volta che un giocatore riesce a Scaricare la Colpa su di un altro giocatore, le Carte Borse passano da un giocatore all’altro.

Quando un giocatore non è in più grado di raccontare scuse credibili, il Boss perde completamente le staffe ed emette la sua Sentenza contro il povero malcapitato e contro il suo protettore. A questo punto la partita finisce e il giocatore che possiede la Sorsa con i Soldi può felicemente svignarsela con il malloppo. Se però la Borsa con i Soldi era nelle mani del giocatore beccato o del suo protettore, sarà il Boss a vincere la partita, recuperando il malloppo.

Are you ready to discover Lovecraftian words in Vudulhu, the party game that cursed thousands of players with tentacles?

Give your opponents a hard time by casting curses on them, forcing them to maintain twisted poses, gurgle like shoggoths, and hold things as if they have tentacles instead of arms and hands. You will gain victory points if they don't resist...

item.description:
Renown - The Game brings back a traditional Austrian card game. The original game is still played in Austria but it is getting more and more forgotten. Decades ago there were many tournaments and it was played in almost every tavern. It is called “Schnapsen”, probably because the winner was rewarded with a shot of schnapps. We have modernized it with a lot of modifications, action and player interactions. We have added a set of action cards which can alter the whole gameplay.

Renown - The Game features four different races: the bloodthirsty Ogres, the forsaken Humfrogs, the greedy Goblins and the schnapps-loving Shiners

Be the first one to earn 48 points by beating your enemies in different round types to win the game. Send your characters into fights and gather 66 Renown which you need to get your beloved points.

To reward the best strategic player there are seven different round types, which give you more points, the more difficult your strategy is to follow. Some of the rounds require you to earn 66 Renown fast, others will challenge you to win all the fights.

Each race has five different characters, who are ranked like this: The Chief, the Warden, the Sorceress, the Soldier and the Dork.

You start each round by selecting a dominating race, which makes every member of this race stronger than any card of the other races. When a player plays a character, the other players usually have to follow with the same race, if they have one. The higher ranked characters beat the lower ranked ones. This means: The chief beats everyone from the warden to the dork, the warden beats everyone from the sorceress to the dork and so on. If a player does not have a card of the first played race, he has to play one of the dominating race. If the player does not have a card of the dominating race either, he needs to send another race into the fight. However, this one cannot beat the first played card.

—description from the designer

Tabletop, grid-based spacefighting (in space). Mothership, 3 Fighters, & 2 "Special" Fighters. Customize your starting fleet by choosing 2 among a pool of Special Fighters. Roll 4 dice each turn. 3 to decide your actions (Move Attack or Draw) & one to decide your distance for each movement action. Spar with your opponent and destroy the enemy Mothership.

Spacefighter, fighting in space.

—description from the publisher

Charlie don't surf!

Full Moon Jacket is a solo and co-operative squad based game in which players take roles of various unique US Marines and Vietnamese Fighters in the Vietnam War. Each character brings their own skills and signature equipment in order to survive against endless waves of Werewolves as Dusk turns to Night.

The hordes of Werewolves are controlled by simple AI rules and to survive against them you must work together using ammo efficiently, searching supply drops for larger more brutal weapons and equipment and scavenging materials to craft your own unique items.

No one game is ever the same. With unique modular boards randomly positioned, supply drops and werewolves randomly spawned and the mission objectives randomly moved, adjust your tactics in a bid to escape the ever changing situation.

One of the main objectives for Full Moon Jacket was to create a strategic game with simple to learn rules and mechanics. Over 30 blind playtests with board game and non-board game fans the mechanics have been understood within 10 minutes of playing and with many new players falling in love with the game. The game has several play modes for Solo play, Quick play, Standard mode with crafting, Nightmare mode (for those ready to be tested!) and Survival mode (last man standing).

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The goal of Choko is to simply be able to the last player with the ability to move. On each turn, a player moves once, twice or three times depending on the throw of the die. Pawns are moved orthoganally. After a pawn is moved, its previous position is marked with a pawn. As the game progresses, pawns become increasingly constricted. As a new counter is added to the boatd with each move, players are able to define areas where there opponents do not have access.

—user summary

Dimentrios is a game about collecting. Collect more, and play will be different each time. But it is more than that. In Dimentrios, you play against a single opponent, trying to reach their base before they reach yours. A simple premise, but victory lies in your own strategy. Strategy is a must for Dimentrios. Simply collecting the most powerful characters will certainly not guarantee you a win. So order today, and become a Dimentrios master.
The game-play could be described as similar to a game like chess, but with enough new value to make it its own game. Value such as collectible cards, new boards, stats such as attack, defense, and health, and different ways to play.

A collection of promo materials (mainly expansions and demo games), released in a zip bag at the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria.

Included are:
1. Geistesblitz: Gratis Demo-Spiel A standalone demoversion of Ghost Blitz
2. Russian Railroads: Juri Dreigleisky
3. First Class: Teatime
4. Piraten Kapern: Sonderkarten
5. NMBR 9: Starting Tiles
6. Top Trumps Star Wars: Tseebo
7. 9 extra large wooden bits from spielmaterial (3 pawns, 3 cubes and 3 octagonal prisms in blue, red and yellow respectively)

Sir Percival, the Round Table, Avalon, and many other cards from the world of King Arthur can help you win by getting zero cards in hand first. Avalon can be played as a stand alone game or an expansion – you may shuffle the cards into a larger deck.

Crazier Eights is a fantasy card game featuring classic artwork. Every card has a unique ability and the first player to have zero cards in hand wins.

There are thirty three unique cards.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Crazier Eights: One Thousand & One Nights

item.description:
The Evil Queen wants a poison for the poison apple. But only the rarest poison based on a dragon's blood will satisfy her needs. The only problem is, the last dragon alive was seen some thousand years ago... So she turns to a covenant of witches for help.

Players take role of the witches that compete to concoct most bottles of the rarest poison in the game (out of 3 kinds). While the total amount of poisons in the game is changing, the rarest type of poison also changes, so the winner is uncertain until the very end. When the 5-th bottle of any type of poison is made, the game ends, and only the rarest poison is counted toward victory condition.

There are 10 action tokens that players may pick, and they represent the actions that each player will play on their next turn. You can not pick action token that are in possession of other player(s).

Players will collect ingredients for the poisons from the game board by rolling dice. But ingredients are expendable and the sources will eventually dry up. So in time, it is harder and harder to collect new ingredients.

Players must discover rituals that can convert certain ingredients into a dragon's blood, necessary for concocting the poisons. Players build their gameplay based on the rituals they have discovered.

Each player starts with one Secret Ally card. If the player finish the game on his turn, and that makes his secret ally player to win - they both win! This eliminates the "kingmaker" mechanic.

The Naked Game is a two-player card game designed for couples. It's the first couples' game to offer a satisfying degree of gameplay depth, while facilitating an intimate experience with your partner.

Playing The Naked Game is always a win-win, because both players are sure to score! With the perfect blend of gameplay and foreplay -- of strategy and action -- it’s a fun and unique way for you and your loved one to spice up a night.

There are two rounds of play, the Warm-Up Round, which sets the mood and rids you of your pesky clothing, and the Action Round, where you choose a sexy action that you desire, and who will perform it on whom. Meanwhile, collect the “SEX!” cards and play them strategically to win the game -- and a reward.

—description from the publisher
Roll-and-move board game designed by The Phillip Island Tourism Board to promote Phillip Island in Victoria Australia. The goal of the games is to be the first to travel around the island.

This is a tile placement game depicting a highly detailed map of Ostereich/Germany. Players need to correctly place the tiles in a puzzle like fashion. The first player to place all their map tiles is the winner.

—user summary

"… If a detailed account of that silent contest could be written, it would take its place as the most brilliant bit of thrust-and-parry work in the history of detection."
-Sherlock Holmes to Dr. Watson in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's "The Final Problem".

Professor Moriarty is almost ready to enact his nefarious plan! Sherlock Holmes suspects that something is about to happen, but he doesn’t know the details. As Moriarty's crimes set the final pieces into place, Holmes desperately searches London for the clues he needs to foil his nemesis. London's greatest intellects go head to head in this intense battle of wits!

Holmes & Moriarty is an asymmetric two-player drafting game in which players take on these iconic roles. Over a series of hands, players try to win "cases" by drafting crimes and clues drawn from Conan Doyle's stories. Players mark their winning positions on the scenario board. If Moriarty can score three in a row, he can activate his master plan for the win! If Holmes can foil Moriarty's plans, he wins!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
A strategic boardgame by TLM to introduce people and employees to their company concepts. You are the boss of a company. Your goal is to fill the companies grid with the indicated number of employees. Therefore, you can recruit them on the board, or make them evolve inside your company's grid. Throughout the game, the itransitions cards will reveal surprises due to economical and political evolutions the same way that such events occur in real life companies. Some are good events and you will be able to capitalise on the economic situation or interestting labor market events. Some are bad, for example, due to a recession or bad social management on your part. The game ends when a player fills his grid.

—user summary

The object of this game is for the PLAYERS, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a RESIDENCE SQUARE to the bank and shopping locations shown on their SHOPPING LISTS. The first PLAYER to return to his RESIDENCE with the TRAVEL CARDS for all locations contained on his SHOPPING LIST wins the game!

—description from the rulebook

name.value: Forest of the Impaled: Vlad Dracula's Final Stand

item.description:
Forest of the Impaled is a cooperative Board Game where up to 6 Muslim players invade and attempt to conquer Romania. Heavily outnumbered, the Dracula player fights with his Christian army to defend his country and survive.

It is loosely based on the historical campaign of Vlad 'Dracula' Tepes in 1462.

To defeat Dracula, the Muslim players must cooperate closely as a team BUT they can ONLY communicate IF their HQs are in the same area. This results in hysterical fun. Miscommunication and confusion reign as Dracula picks off his enemies in detail.

—description from the publisher

The Toy Box Monsters YOU ROLL! Become Kids of Legendary Monsters. Collect the Most Candy on Halloween.

The legendary monsters that we grew up with, now have kids of their own. In Monster Dice, you become little monsters rolling through the neighborhood trying to get the most candy on Halloween.

Open the box to reveal your 8 Monster Dice and Candy Cards. This is everything you need to play various mini-games that will test your speed, reflexes, and hand-eye coordination.

—description from the publisher

Byebyechuchu makes debut with mysterious surprises.
Go with Ology for the delivery!!
Sprint, deliver and upgrade.
Map out the best routes.
Deliver the most merchandises and complete the most orders.

You may collect the goods from bookshops, pizza, beverage and hamburger shops. Find those who want to gain some weight. Deliver the goods to others and get paid. Then you will get stronger. After upgrade, you can get various kinds of fancy abilities.
